intro: Chirita blumei var. cordifolia, commonly known as the heart-leaf chirita, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically orange or yellow in color. It is often cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit. Chirita blumei var. cordifolia thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
